title: Bug 131649 - Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table
description: Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table. This design uses a 2-level table to list offices and their employees. You can construct an expression like this: row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"]. However, this report will not run. The correct behavior when the user double-clicks on "COUNTRY" is to insert rows[0]["COUNTRY"] into the expression. The first index (an integer) to the "rows" array is the 0-based index of the nested table which contains the data set (0 = outermost table, 1 = first-level inner table, etc.).
OB: When double-clicking on "COUNTRY" in the report, the generated expression does not insert the correct reference to the country column, making the report fail to run.
EB: The report designer should automatically determine the correct index number by analyzing the nesting levels of all tables and should generate the expression as rows[0]["COUNTRY"].
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the attached report design (test1.rptdesign).
2. Double-click on the inner list's Data Item to edit its expression.
3. Click on "Available Data Sets," choose the data set "offices," then double-click on the column "COUNTRY."
